PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7915 - Network as Code: DevOps Implications of Programmable Infrastructure
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Following up on last year's extremely popular session on DevOps and Automation via the API, Justin and Mitesh demonstrate a robust DevOps platform able to programmatically build, reconfigure, and deploy infrastructure. Observe a live demo of Puppet / Ansible integrated infrastructure as code paradigm, including software version control and revision history to capture the entire stack. During the session, the demo will showcase exporting an infrastructure and application configuration to Github, followed by NSX configuration as code and evaluation of proposed firewall rule changes using pull requests, and final implementation of the firewall changes via a branch merge and approval to deploy applications.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8969 - Forrester Research POV on DevOps, Automation, and Virtualization Maturity Trends
PresentationDetailsList.Description: IT execs continue to overweigh cost as the major driver for data center investments. Many business execs see cost as important but not at the expense of business performance or agility. In all of this, the linkage to automation as a critical enabler to drive both increased agility and lower costs does not appear to be well understood. Join this session to hear Forrester and VMware review a recent market research study that provides insights into key trends in maturity across DevOps, automation, and virtualization. We'll also address how these trends relate to cloud management capabilities that VMware is delivering to the marketplace.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8255 - Evolving the vSphere API for the Modern Era
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In this session, you will get an overview of the current vSphere API as well as some tips and tricks on how to use it. We will explore some of the different methods and tools that are available to a variety of audiences (vSphere Administrators, Developers, etc) when automating against the vSphere API. We will also provide a “Technical Preview” based showing of where we are headed and some of new tools and features that will be available to you to automate and develop against the next generation of the vSphere Platform. This is a must attend session for anyone focused on Automation, DevOps or Development.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8499 - Moving to Infrastructure as Code: How Fannie Mae Is Managing the SDDC with the vRCS Management Pack (aka Project Houdini)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Adopting DevOps is typically considered within the context of application development. But if you are going to have code (e.g. vRealize Automation blueprints, vSphere templates, vRealize Orchestrator workflows, etc.) describe your infrastructure, you will need to manage these artifacts the same way that developers manage the lifecycle of their applications. This session will help IT administrators and cloud architects understand how they can adopt DevOps best practices to help them manage their private and public cloud infrastructure artifacts. We’ll explain how Fannie Mae is leveraging vRealize Code Stream and the pre-built vRealize Code Stream Management Pack for IT DevOps (also known as “Houdini”) to move to an Infrastructure as Code operational model for vRealize Automation blueprints and vRealize Orchestrator workflows. We’ll also explain and demonstrate how this solution helps vSphere, vRealize Operations and NSX administrators manage the lifecycle of software defined infrastructure across Dev, Test and Production environments. Finally, we’ll demonstrate the latest improvements, including integration with popular source code management systems.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP9093 - Unpanel: How I Survived the DevOps Transition
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Join this interactive panel discussion with Reg Lo and Ed Hoppitt as they moderate a lively exchange between IT practitioners and their development counterparts. You will hear about the dos, don'ts, and gotchas from both perspectives. We will invite the audience to participate with their opinions and insights, and they might become part of the panel.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP9403-SPO - Hacking Your Backups: Making Your Backup Data & Systems Work for You
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Backup and Data Protection used to be about making copies of your production data in case something went wrong. Today, IT environments need to be automated, self-optimizing and self-scaling, data needs to be productive and unlocked from its original application, and your systems must work across multiple vendors – including multiple cloud vendors. Learn how to hack your backup system to create an automated, self-service, optimized datacenter, accelerate test & development, and bridge multiple vendor platforms on-premises and in the cloud.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP8924 - Building an Actionable Strategy Around DevOps and Platform as a Service (PaaS)
PresentationDetailsList.Description: In most industries, the first to release that new killer app is the one that wins. Infrastructure in itself does not add direct value to a business. Although it is essential that you deliver infrastructure quickly, its value lies in helping deploy applications more quickly, building services around those applications, and drastically increasing time to market. A true platform as a service (PaaS) and DevOps framework will help your developers deliver software quickly and efficiently, but all of this hinges on putting together a clear strategy across technology, people, and process. In this session, get practical advice for creating a roadmap that incorporates the tools, process, and framework that will provide the most value. We will discuss creating a business case for PaaS, how to pick the right PaaS platforms for your business, building a DevOps software supply chain and operating model that will best leverage the technology you choose, addressing process and culture along with technology for successful implementation of PaaS, and effectively consuming PaaS services.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7858R - Reference Design for SDDC with NSX and vSphere: Part 2
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This is a second part of a two-part session covering reference design for Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) with VMware NSX. The session starts with best practices with all types of deployment: small, medium, and large. It then covers the enhancement and introduction of new features and its use case available in the latest release of NSX software, such as multi-VC, universal logical networking, and multi-instance TCP/IP stack. The session further extends the topology and use case covering multitenancy, design considerations for IT automation for IT, DevOps, and multisite design strategy. The session ends with best practices for security design considerations and use case enabling virtual desktop infrastructure and end-user computing.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP8971 - Run a Hybrid Application Across VMware and Google Cloud Platform
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Companies today have a variety of infrastructure options to run their applications on. The rise of cloud computing now gives companies the ability to run applications in their own datacenter or run applications by using the services of cloud providers. But what if you could run an application hybrid across your own datacenters and that of a cloud provider; the best of both worlds combined!? Many organizations today run their own datacenters. That means that all applications and their data is stored within VMware and the underlying infrastructure. But what we now see is that companies are looking toward cloud providers to consume certain services as they are cheaper, more scalable or faster than what they can within their own datacenters. Google over the years has built an excellent infrastructure to host its own services such as GMail, Youtube and Apps. The underlying infrastructure services are now made available to end-users through Google Cloud Platform. In this session we’ll explain how you can extend you existing and new applications with VMware and Google Cloud Platform services. We will show you how to run an application across both cloud platforms. This way you can use your existing applications and data while leveraging the capabilities that both VMware and Google Cloud Platform have to offer. VMware and Google. The best of both worlds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8831 - Digital Transformation Through VMware DevOps Code Stream
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Électricité de France S.A. (EDF) is a French electric utility company, largely owned by the French state. Headquartered in Paris and with €65.2 billion in revenues in 2010, EDF operates a diverse portfolio of more than 120 gigawatts of generation capacity in Europe, South America, North America, Asia, the Middle East, and Africa. The company is also the world's largest producer of electricity. In 2011, it produced 22 percent of the European Union's electricity, primarily from nuclear power. EDF has also started its IT transformation from a service integrator to a service operator, delivering global IT services, on demand, for headquarters, business lines, and subsidiaries. After 20 M$ ELA vCloud suite Unlimited signed in Q4FY14, EDF Service offers starting Q12015 , EDF wants to continue to be a key player for the business and not just for IT by improving the Innovation Time to Market. Faster, Agile and more flexible approach to increase the numbers of application release. At the highest level, EDF also launched "EDF 2020" plan to begin DevOps initiatives while embracing the open-source world and keeping a high level of security and governance. By leveraging the "EDF New Cloud" platform based on vRealize, the VMware team succeeded in considering DevOps world as an other potential cost optimization , Innovation accelerator for all Line Of Business. VMware started with two streams to prove the by managing technical and financial benefices. We demonstrated DevOps capabilities consuming their Cloud platform and working closely with the Innovation department to build a their Digital Transformation Plan. All of applications release within the corporate division will be processing by our platform solution. For VMware, is not only a new deal but our capabilities to support our customers in their Digital Innovation transformation.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8546 - Case Study: Extreme Dogfooding of SDDC for VMware R&D's Private Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Discover how VMware R&D embraces the Software-Defined Data Center to handle nearly all product testing on on-demand virtual testbeds. "Nimbus," VMware R&D's private cloud, is built for resiliency, scalability, ease of use, and repeatability. Developers utilize a simplified command line interface in their development workflows to automate deployment of more than 70,000 virtual machines daily. DevOps, operations teams, IT administrators, and architects interested in high-churn, high-volume cloud environments should come discover the insights and challenges of the VMware Nimbus cloud's development and management and the collaborative software stack that drives it all.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7859 - Real-World DevOps Customer Panel
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware customers along with G18 will discuss challenges faced, lessons learned, and best practices for implementing a DevOps initiative. Customers from differing backgrounds, scale, and interest will discuss the common threads and requirements driving their DevOps initiatives. How VMware technologies, Professional Services, and processes were crucial in implementing such DevOps deliveries will be outlined.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7730 - DevOps Bootcamp Actual
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware customers along with Professional Services organization representatives will discuss challenges faced, lessons learned, and best practices for implementing a DevOps initiative. Customers from differing backgrounds, scale, and interest will discuss the common threads and requirements driving their DevOps initiatives. How VMware technologies, Professional Services, and processes were crucial in implementing such DevOps deliveries will be outlined.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP9965-SPO - Implementing DevOps with VMware vRealize and Cisco UCS
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware vRealize is an excellent framework for implementing DevOps-ready IT. Cisco UCS was designed from the beginning to manage infrastructure as code. This session will explain how the integrations that Cisco and VMware have developed together can help your organization transition to higher levels of automation and DevOps. It will include demos, information regarding SDKs, and an overview of the open ecosystem Cisco has developed to help organizations implement DevOps methodologies.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET8368 - Network as a Service (NaaS) Transformation with NSX
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Transformation doesn’t happen by configuring and integrating software solutions alone. Process and organizational transformation enable the business to achieve the full value proposition of those solutions. Like server and desktop virtualization before it, many organizations focus their implementations on the technical considerations of architecture, design, configuration, and integration. All too often, infrastructure teams reach day 1 operations without: • updated processes to maintain & support (operationalize) • a fully enabled organization • overarching governance Learn an effective approach on how to leverage IT Service Management practices within the Cloud COE and DevOps organization to drive business value for Cloud Services. This session uses VMware NSX as the vehicle to provide an operational and organizational view on how to leverage Network Virtualization architecture to move toward a Network as a Service (NaaS) operating model and ultimately toward the IT as a Service (ITaaS) operating model. Topics discussed will be: • NaaS Operating Model as part of the ITaaS Operating model • Organizational impact and challenges of Network Virtualization adoption • Incremental and iterative approach to building your organization and processes. • Sample use cases for addressing security compliance (NIST / HIPAA / PCI) • Next steps for engagement of transformation services

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8540-SPO - Say Yes to vRA and vRO in a Real-World Hybrid Cloud
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Automation? Easier said than done—but we’ll take you through it. This session takes a real-world approach to demonstrate how to design and implement automation catalogs step by step with vRealize Automation (vRA) and vRealize Ochestrator (vRO). Utilizing Tintri automation workflows, we’ll uncover the power of self-service when application owners are empowered to manage storage-related tasks such as snapshotting, cloning and replication. Plus,from a real customer example,learn how quality of service (QoS) and replication policies can be automated in a hybrid cloud environment to enable granular disaster recovery capabilities. DevOps and QA teams can benefit from the self-service portals to automate data synchronization and data governance.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: INF8635 - vSphere Content Library: Organize, Distribute, and Utilize Your Content Effortlessly
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Data is growing at an incredible pace, and the same is true about the content in your data centers, including virtual machine templates and ISO files. If done right, content management helps you to save two priceless resources: time and effort. VMware vSphere Content Library is the tool for the job, and this session will teach you how to use it efficiently, including content onboarding, integration with DevOps tools and Bitnami, and content customization and utilization.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: NET7858R - Reference Design for SDDC with NSX and vSphere: Part 2
PresentationDetailsList.Description: This is a second part of a two-part session covering reference design for Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC) with VMware NSX. The session starts with best practices with all types of deployment: small, medium, and large. It then covers the enhancement and introduction of new features and its use case available in the latest release of NSX software, such as multi-VC, universal logical networking, and multi-instance TCP/IP stack. The session further extends the topology and use case covering multitenancy, design considerations for IT automation for IT, DevOps, and multisite design strategy. The session ends with best practices for security design considerations and use case enabling virtual desktop infrastructure and end-user computing.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7788 - Industry Perspective: Enterprise Reality of Doing DevOps
PresentationDetailsList.Description:
As companies develop their agendas around how they leverage digital technology, more and more pressure is being put on applications development and IT organizations to step up and deliver.

Successful enterprise organizations are those that are evolving the capabilities of their platforms to deliver for the needs of the developer, embracing technical and organizational change and leveraging a structured roadmap to derisk and accelerate change, but without building tomorrow's technical debt today.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7674 - vRA, API, CI, Oh My!
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Take a deep dive into DevOps best practices with VMware vRealize Automation and Code Stream. Learn how vRealize Automation and Code Stream enable development teams from precommit to production. In this session we will explore how Code Stream manages the release pipeline for development of open-source integrations such as the Jenkins vRA plug-in and vRA Blueprint Deployment Library for Java. This session will demonstrate the ability for vRealize solutions to enable the development pipeline for precommit validation, virtual machine/container provisioning, automated testing, log analysis, and promotion of releases.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: MGT8766 - How IT Can Enable DevOps and Development Teams to Rapidly Deliver and Iterate Robust Applications in a Multicloud Environment including VMware, AWS, Azure and Softlayer
PresentationDetailsList.Description: Many organizations today are in the process of transforming their IT and want to ensure that their developers are first-class citizens in the cloud. Learn from our expert panel about how they offer a self-service catalogue that helps developers 1) deliver platform as a service not just infrastructure as a service, 2) manage apps to overcome hurdles posed by ever-changing platform libraries and APIs, 3) integrate with CI/CD tools, 4) burst into cloud, and 5) manage long-term risks by building apps that can be easily migrated between clouds.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP7447 - Redefining Enterprise Resource Planning Using vSphere 6 and Workspace ONE
PresentationDetailsList.Description: When executing business transformation where do companies look in order to initiate large financial impact? As part of VMware's business transformation, the company is rolling out SAP globally for Record-to-Report and indirect procurement business processes. VMware IT will be one of the first global customers to deploy SAP High-Performance Analytic Appliance (HANA) on vSphere 6 under the controlled availability program. To further amplify the end user experience VMware is using Workspace ONE, Single Sign-On and mobile device management to run SAP on any device.

PresentationDetailsList.Name: DEVOP8630 - Increased Employee Productivity with Enterprise-Grade Security Using VMware IT’s Managed Public Key Infrastructure Service and AirWatch
PresentationDetailsList.Description: VMware had a critical need for multi-factor authentication. VMW solved this problem by implementing VMware Managed Public Key Infrastructure Service (mPKI) which is scalable and provides high availability, redundant infrastructure with back up and disaster recovery features. VMware mPKI supports the full PKI lifecycle and key management including: enrollment, revocation, renewal and recovery procedures. For mobile devices, integration of mPKI with AirWatch provides a secure mechanism to install, revoke and renew certificates automatically, a seamless sign-on experience, the ability for executives to securely view bookings data. The workflow within AirWatch handles security risks associated with disabled active directory (AD) accounts, stolen or lost devices, an employee leaving the company and other scenarios when keys can be compromised. The AirWatch self-service portal also helps users to self manage their devices. The advantages of VMware mPKI includes using a dedicated private two tier hierarchy Certificate Authority (CA) environment. This environment is being used to issue certificates to managed VMware devices by providing VMware with the necessary keys and certificate controls. VMware Workspace ONE with Mobile Single Sign-On (SSO) was integrated with mPKI to provide a seamless single sign on experience to employees on AirWatch-enrolled devices. VMware wireless environment was integrated with mPKI to provide more secure access to employees without the need for a virtual private network (VPN) on VMware managed devices. By integrating mPKI with Palo Alto Network Global Protect VPN authentication access is now based on certificates and AD credentials.
